attributes.gcd: Refers to the unique identifier of the account or contract held by the customer. Account number is defined as numbers, letters or alphanumeric code assigned to every significant customer, supplier and lender for ease of reference in accounting records of the financial institution.
Refers to the date as on which the snapshot of source data extracted for processing.
Refers to the charges write off amount. Indicates the amount Charges that has been written or Charged off.

Refers to the source system from where data is extracted. Data can be sourced from multiple sources, this column will Refers to the source code from where the data is extracted for this extraction date.

ISO currency codes is a standard published by the International Organization for Standardization 4217, which delineates currency designators and country codes, alpha and numeric. This column will capture the standardized currency code. Currency dimension is the equivalent dimension table for this column.

Refers to the amount Interest that has been written or Charged off. This amount includes only overdue interest on that account. Asset write offs happen when a loan repayment is delayed and any efforts by the collection and recovery department of the financial institution are unsuccessful or partially successful.

attributes.logicalName: Interest Write Off Charged To Allowance For Loan And Lease And Losses
attributes.gcd: Refers to the Interest Write off amount charged to Allowance for Loan and lease losses.
Refers to the entity code of the legal entity to which the account will be attributed in the general ledger.

Refers to the amount written off as bad debt. This amount includes only overdue principal on that account. Asset write offs happen when a loan repayment is delayed and any efforts by the collection and recovery department of the financial institution are unsuccessful or partially successful.

attributes.logicalName: Principal Write Off Charged To Allowance For Loan And Lease And Losses
attributes.gcd: Refers to the Principle Write off amount charged to Allowance for Loan and lease losses.
Refers to the record creation date. It has been added to all catalog entities to enable partitioning and archival.
Refers to the run identifier for a set of Records participating in the particular Run with the Run Execution identifier. This is a combination of Run Main Identifier and Run Execution Identifier.

Flag indicates whether the write off is technical or prudential or complete write off. Technical or prudential write off means the accounts that have been written off in books of Head Office but still exist in branch books i.e. shadow book. List of Values are Y, N.

Refers to the date on which the asset was written off from the books of the financial institution. Asset write offs happen when a loan repayment is delayed and any efforts by the collection and recovery department of the financial institution are unsuccessful or partially successful.
Refers to the unique code of the write off reason in case of accounts with write offs. Common reasons for write offs include bankruptcy, legal issues, death of the customer etc.

governance.dqDesc: Should have list of values as N,Y
governance.dqType: List of Values or Code Check

governance.dqDesc: Reference Check for As Of Date in Stage Account Write Off Details
Reference Check for As Of Date in Stage Account Write Off Details
Reference Check for Write Off Date in Stage Account Write Off Details
Reference Check for Write Off Date in Stage Account Write Off Details
Reference Check for Account Or Contract Number in Stage Account Write Off Details
Reference Check for Data Source Code in Stage Account Write Off Details
Reference Check for ISO Currency Code in Stage Account Write Off Details
Reference Check for Legal Entity Code in Stage Account Write Off Details
Reference Check for Write Off Reason Code in Stage Account Write Off Details
